GaloyAddressScreen.notAbleToChange: Adresin ayarlandıktan sonra {bankName: string} bir daha değiştirilemeyecek.
GaloyAddressScreen.somethingWentWrong: Bir hata oluştu. Lütfen tekrar deneyin.
GaloyAddressScreen.howToUseYourAddressExplainer:
Your {bankName: string} address is your own Lightning address. It’s like an email address, but for your Bitcoin.

To receive payments, share your full address to someone using a wallet supporting the Lightning address.

These wallets support it:
GaloyAddressScreen.howToUseYourPaycodeExplainer:
You can print your Paycode (which is an amountless invoice) and display it in your business to receive payments. Individuals can pay you by scanning it with a Lightning-enabled wallet.

However, be aware that some wallets can’t scan an amountless invoice such as:
GaloyAddressScreen.howToUseYourCashRegisterExplainer:
Your Cash Register let your employees collect payments without needing to give them access to your wallet.

Share your link. They can pin it to their homescreen and generate Lightning invoices on your behalf. The payments collected using the Cash Register will be sent directly to your Bitcoin Beach Wallet.
GaloyAddressScreen.whatIsDefaultWalletDescription: Your default wallet is the wallet that will be used when receiving payments through the POS. You can change it at any time here in the settings.

ContactsScreen.noContactsYet: Send or receive a payment using a username and contacts will automatically be added here
ContactsScreen.noMatchingContacts: No contacts matching your search were found.
ContactsScreen.title: Kontaktlar

answers: Dijital para
Video oyunu
Yeni bir çizgi film karakteri
feedback: Doğru. 1 “sat” kazandın.
Yanlış, lütfen tekrar deneyin.
Hayır. En azından biz öyle bilmiyoruz'
whatIsBitcoin.question: Bitcoin tam olarak nedir?
whatIsBitcoin.text:
Bitcoin dijital bir paradır.

Bir banka, finansal kuruluş veya herhangi bir aracı gerektirmeden iki kişinin kendi arasında anında ve güvenle transfer gerçekleştirmesine izin verir.
whatIsBitcoin.title: Bitcoin tam olarak nedir?

answers: Bitcoin'in en küçük birimi
Küçük bir uydudur
Bir uzay kedisidir 🐱🚀
feedback: Doğru. İki sats daha kazandınız!!
Belki... ama bu içerik için doğru cevap bu değil 🙂
Hmmm.... tam değil!
sat.question: Bir “Sat" kazandım. “Sat" nedir?
sat.text:
One “Sat” is the smallest unit of a bitcoin. 

We all know that one US Dollar can be divided into 100 cents. Similarly, one Bitcoin can be divided into 100,000,000 sats. 

In fact, you do not need to own one whole bitcoin in order to use it. You can use bitcoin whether you have 20 sats, 3000 sats — or 100,000,000 sats (which you now know is equal to one bitcoin).
sat.title: Bir 'Sat' kazadım. 'Sat' nedir?

answers: İnternet üzerinde
Ayın üzerinde
Merkez bankası hesabında
feedback: Doğru. 5 sats daha kazandınız.
Yanlış, en azından hala doğru değil.
Yanlış, tekrardan deneyiniz.
whereBitcoinExist.question: Bitcoinler nerede durur?
whereBitcoinExist.text:
Bitcoin is a new form of money. It can be used by anyone, anytime -- anywhere in the world. 

It is not tied to a specific government or region (like US Dollars). There are also no paper bills, metal coins or plastic cards. 

Everything is 100% digital. Bitcoin is a network of computers running on the internet. 

Your bitcoin is easily managed with software on your smartphone or computer!
whereBitcoinExist.title: Bitcoinler nerede durur?

answers: Dünya üzerine yayılmış gönüllülerden oluşan bir komünite
Simpsons'daki Mr. Burns karakteri
Fransa Hükümeti
feedback: That is right. Bitcoin is made possible by people all around the world running bitcoin software on their computers and smartphones.
Muhteşem bir düşünce ama doğru değil!
Yanlış, Bitcoin'i kontrol eden bir firma veya devlet yoktur.
whoControlsBitcoin.question: Bitcoin'i kim kontrol eder?
whoControlsBitcoin.text:
Bitcoin is not controlled by any person, company or government. 

It is run by the community of users -- people and companies all around the world -- voluntarily running bitcoin software on their computers and smartphones.
whoControlsBitcoin.title: Bitcoin'i kim kontrol eder?

answers: Hayır, bitcoinin değerini kopyalamak imkansızdır.
Bitcoin'lerini dijital bir fotoğrafı kopylar gibi kolaylıkla kopyalayabilirsin
Evet, ama bitcoini kopyalamak çok özel bilgisayarlar gerektirir
feedback: Bu kesinlikle doğru cevap!
Bunun doğru olmadığını biliyorsun. Tekrar deneyin.
Yanlış, hiç kimse bir Bitcoin'i kopyalama veya çoğaltmayı beceremez.
copyBitcoin.question: Eğer Bitcoin dijital bir paraysa, o zaman birisi onu kopyalayarak bedavadan para yaratamaz mı?
copyBitcoin.text:
The value of a bitcoin can never be copied. This is the very reason why Bitcoin is such a powerful new invention!!

Most digital files — such as an iPhone photo, an MP3 song, or a Microsoft Word document — can easily be duplicated and shared. 

The Bitcoin software uniquely prevents the duplication — or “double spending” — of digital money. We will share exactly how this works later on!
copyBitcoin.title: Eğer Bitcoin dijital bir paraysa, o zaman birisi onu kopyalayarak bedavadan para yaratamaz mı?

answers: Çünkü insanlar başka insanların da parayı benzer bir şekilde değerleyeceğine inanır
Çünkü anneniz size öyle öğretmiştir
Bir dolarlık bir kağıt para ağırlığı kadar altının değerini taşır
feedback: Doğru. Paranın işe yaramasının sebebi budur.
Öyle öğretmiş olabilir ama yine de bu sorunun doğru cevabı seçtiğiniz cevap değil!
Nope. In the past you could exchange US dollars for gold. But this is no longer the case.
moneySocialAggrement.question: Paranın neden değeri vardır?
moneySocialAggrement.text:
Money requires people to trust. 

People trust the paper dollar bills in their pocket. They trust the digits in their online bank account. They trust the balance on a store gift card will be redeemable. 

Having money allows people to easy trade it immediately for a good, or a service.
moneySocialAggrement.title: Para sosyal bir anlaşıdır.

answers: İhtiyaçların eşleşmesi
Gece ve gündüzün eşleşmesi
Ayın güneşi bloklaması durumu
feedback: That is right. Money allows you to easily purchase something, without haggling about the form of payment
No silly, you know that is not the answer.
Tam olarak değil, biz ona güneş tutulması diyoruz 🌚
coincidenceOfWants.question: Para hangi rastlantıyı çözer?
coincidenceOfWants.text:
Centuries ago, before people had money, they would barter -- or haggle over how to trade one unique item, in exchange for another item or service. 

Let’s say you wanted to have a meal at the local restaurant, and offered the owner a broom. The owner might say “no” -- but I will accept three hats instead, if you happen to have them. 

You can imagine how difficult and inefficient a “barter economy” would be !  

By contrast, with money, you can simply present a $20 bill. And you know that the restaurant owner will readily accept it.
coincidenceOfWants.title: Para 'ihtiyaçaların eşleşmesi' durumunu çözer. Peki bu nedir?

answers: Çakıl taşları, deniz kabukları ve altın
Küçük plastik Monopoly oyunu evleri
Para görünümlü çikolatalar
feedback: Doğru. Nadir bulunan ve kopyalanması zor olan şeyler genellikle para olarak kullanılır.
Wrong. They may have value when playing a game -- but not in the real word!
Nope. They may be tasty. But they are not useful as money.
moneyEvolution.question: What are some items that have been historically used as a unit of money?
moneyEvolution.text:
Thousands of years ago, society in Micronesia used very large and scarce stones as a form of agreed currency. 

Starting in the 1500’s, rare Cowrie shells (found in the ocean) became commonly used in many nations as a form of money.

And for millennia, gold has been used as a form of money for countries around the world -- including the United States (until 1971).
moneyEvolution.title: Money has evolved, since almost the beginning of time.

answers: Because they have key characteristics -- such as being durable, uniform and divisible.
Çünkü güzel görünür ve parlaktırlar.
Çünkü cebinize sığabilirler
feedback: Correct. More key characteristics include being scarce and portable.
Incorrect. That may be true, but alone are not great characteristics of money.
Not quite. Although these items were surely portable, that alone was not the reason to be used as money.
whyStonesShellGold.question: Why were stones, seashells and gold used as units of money?
whyStonesShellGold.text:
Well, these items all had some -- but not all -- of the characteristics of good money. 

So what characteristics make for “good” money? 
Scarce: not abundant, nor easy to reproduce or copy 
Accepted: relatively easy for people to verify its authenticity 
Durable: easy to maintain, and does not perish or fall apart
Uniform: readily interchangeable with another item of the same form
Portable: easy to transport
Divisible: can be split and shared in smaller pieces
whyStonesShellGold.title: Why were stones, shells and gold commonly used as money in the past?

answers: Money allows people to buy goods and services today -- and tomorrow.
Para aya gitmenize olanak sağlar.
Para bütün sorunların çözümüdür.
feedback: Bu doğru cevap!
Incorrect. Although that may change in the future ;)
Not quite. Although some people may believe such, this answer does not address the primary purpose of money.
moneyIsImportant.question: What is the primary reason money is important?
moneyIsImportant.text:
Everybody knows that money matters.

Most people exchange their time and energy -- in the form of work -- to obtain money. People do so, to be able to buy goods and services today -- and in the future.
moneyIsImportant.title: Money is important to individuals

answers: Amerikan Merkez Bankası
Mr Burns from The Simpsons
A guy with a printing press in his basement
feedback: Correct. The US Government can print as much money as they want at any time.
Incorrect. Although it did seem like he always had a lot of money.
No. Whilst some people do create fake dollar bills, it is definitely not legal!
moneyImportantGovernement.question: Who can legally print US Dollars, anytime they wish?
moneyImportantGovernement.text:
Modern-day economies are organized by nation-states: USA, Japan, Switzerland, Brazil, Norway, China, etc. 

Accordingly, in most every nation, the government holds the power to issue and control money. 

In the United States, the Central Bank (known as the Federal Reserve, or “Fed”) can print, or create, more US Dollars at any time it wants. 

The “Fed” does not need permission from the President, nor Congress, and certainly not from US citizens.  

Imagine if you had the ability to print US Dollars anytime you wanted to -- what would you do??
moneyImportantGovernement.title: Money is also important to governments

answers: It is created by order of the National government in a given country.
By the manager of the local branch bank.
The Monopoly Money Man.
feedback: Correct. The central bank of a government creates fiat money.
Incorrect. A local bank can only manage money that has been previously created by the government.
Hayır, bir daha deneyin.
WhatIsFiat.question: Amerikan Doları veya İsviçre Frankı gibi itibari fiat paraları kim üretir?
WhatIsFiat.text:
All national currencies in circulation today are called “fiat” money. This includes US Dollars, Japanese Yen, Swiss Francs, and so forth. 

The word “fiat” is latin for “by decree” -- which means “by official order”. 

This means that all fiat money -- including the US Dollar -- is simply created by the order of the national government.
WhatIsFiat.title: İtibari fiat para birimleri: Sonrası ne?

answers: All fiat currency is eventually abused by government authorities.
Local banks might not have enough vault space to hold all of the dollar bills.
There might not be enough trees to make paper for all of the additional dollar bills.
feedback: Correct. Throughout history, governments have been unable to resist the ability to print money, as they effectively have no obligation to repay this money.
Nope, that is certainly not the case.
Wrong. Please try again.
whyCareAboutFiatMoney.question: Why should I care about the government controlling fiat money?
whyCareAboutFiatMoney.text:
As shared in a prior quiz, the US Central Bank is the Federal Reserve, or the “Fed”.

The Fed can print more dollars at any time -- and does not need permission from the President, nor Congress, and certainly not from US citizens.  

Having control of money can be very tempting for authorities to abuse -- and often time leads to massive inflation, arbitrary confiscation and corruption. 

In fact, Alan Greenspan, the famous former chairman of The Fed, famously said the US “can pay any debt that it has, because we can always print more to do that”.
whyCareAboutFiatMoney.title:
I trust my government. 
Why should I care about fiat money?

answers: The printing of additional money leads to inflation.
People must exchange old dollar bills at the bank every year.
The appearance of the dollar bill changes.
feedback: Correct. This means that goods and services will cost more in the future.
Nope. Older dollar bills are just as valid as newer ones.
Incorrect. Although the government may issue new looks for bills, this has nothing to do with increasing the money supply.
GovernementCanPrintMoney.question: What does it mean when the government prints money?
GovernementCanPrintMoney.text:
Well, everybody should care! 

The practice of government printing money -- or increasing the supply of dollars -- leads to inflation.

Inflation is an increase in the price of goods and services. In other words, the price for something in the future will be more expensive than today.

So what does inflation mean for citizens? 

In the United Kingdom, the Pound Sterling has lost 99.5% of its value since being introduced over 300 years ago. 

In the United States, the dollar has lost 97% of its value since the end of WWI, about 100 years ago. 

This means a steak that cost $0.30 in 1920... was $3 in 1990… and about $15 today, in the year 2020!
GovernementCanPrintMoney.title: Who should care that the government can print unlimited money?

answers: Every fiat currency that ever existed has lost a massive amount of value.
Değer sonsuza kadar aynı kalır.
The look and design of paper bills is updated every 10 years or so.
feedback: Correct. This is true even for USD, which has lost 97% of its value during the last 100 years.
Incorrect. Please try again.
Not quite. Although the design of papers bills may change, this has nothing to do with their value.
FiatLosesValueOverTime.question: What happens to the value of all fiat money over time?
FiatLosesValueOverTime.text:
That is correct. 

In the history of the world, there have been 775 fiat currencies created. Most no longer exist, and the average life for any fiat money is only 27 years.

The British Pound is the oldest fiat currency. It has lost more than 99% of its value since 1694. 

There is no precedent for any fiat money maintaining its value over time. This is inflation. 
It is effectively a form of theft of your own hard earned money !
FiatLosesValueOverTime.title: Does this mean that all fiat money loses value over time?

answers: Money is difficult to move around the world, and can also be surveilled.
Money is no longer needed in the 21st Century.
Para bütün kötülüklerin anasıdır.
feedback: Correct. We will explain more about these issues in subsequent quiz modules. Keep digging!!
Wrong answer. You know that is not true.
While some may believe this to be so, it is not the answer we are looking for here.
OtherIssues.question: What are some other issues that exist with fiat money?
OtherIssues.text:
Yes, there are many other issues that exist with modern fiat money. 

First, it can be extremely difficult to move money around the world. Often, governments will outright restrict the movement -- and sometimes even confiscate money -- without a valid reason or explanation. And even when you can send money, high transaction fees make it very expensive.

Second, even in the US, there has been a complete loss of privacy, as the majority of commerce takes places with debit and credit cards, as well as online with other systems such as PayPal and Apple Pay.

Ever notice how an ad appears in your social media or Gmail just moments after searching for a certain product or service? This is known as “surveillance capitalism”, and is based on companies selling your personal financial data.
OtherIssues.title: OK, fiat money loses value over time. Are there other issues?

answers: Evet. Hiç bir zaman 21 milyondan fazla Bitcoin oluşturulamayacak.
No. The government can create more bitcoin at any time.
No, the bitcoin software can be changed to allow more bitcoins to be created.
feedback: Correct. By limiting the amount that can be created, Bitcoin is designed to increase in value over time.
Wrong answer. The government has no control over Bitcoin.
Incorrect. One of the key attributes of bitcoin is that the supply is limited forever.
LimitedSupply.question: Is the supply of bitcoin limited forever?
LimitedSupply.text:
Governments can print fiat money in unlimited quantities. 

By way of contrast, the supply of Bitcoin is fixed — and can never exceed 21 million coins. 

A continually increasing supply of fiat money creates inflation. This means that the money you hold today is less valuable in the future. 

One simple example: 
A loaf of bread that cost about 8 cents in 1920. In the year 1990 one loaf cost about $1.00, and today the price is closer to $2.50 ! 

The limited supply of bitcoin has the opposite effect, one of deflation. 

This means that the bitcoin you hold today is designed to be more valuable in the future — because it is scarce.
LimitedSupply.title:
Special Characteristic #1:
Limited Supply

answers: Hayır, Bitcoin tamamen merkezsizdir.
Yes. It is centrally controlled by the United Nations.
Yes. It is centrally controlled by the world’s largest banks.
feedback: That is correct. There is no company, government or institution that controls bitcoin. Anyone can use bitcoin — all need is a smartphone and an internet connection.
Wrong answer. Please try again.
Incorrect. You already know this is not true!
Decentralized.question: Bitcoin merkezi midir?
Decentralized.text:
Fiat money is controlled by banks and governments — which is why people refer to it as a “centralized” currency.

Bitcoin is not controlled by any person, government or company — which makes it “decentralized” 

Not having banks involved means that nobody can deny you access to bitcoin — because of race, gender, income, credit history, geographical location — or any other factor. 

Anybody — anywhere in the world — can access and use Bitcoin anytime you want. All you need is a computer or smartphone, and an internet connection!
Decentralized.title: Special Characteristic #2: Decentralized

answers: No. It is impossible to counterfeit Bitcoin.
Yes. Although creating fake bitcoin requires very specialized computers.
Yes. The government can print as much bitcoin as it likes.
feedback: That is the right answer. In a subsequent quiz, Honey Badger will explain details as to why this is so!
Incorrect. There is no way for anyone to copy or duplicate the value of a bitcoin.
Wrong. Although the government can print unlimited dollars, it can not print bitcoin.
NoCounterfeitMoney.question: Can people counterfeit Bitcoin?
NoCounterfeitMoney.text:
Paper money, checks and credit card transactions can all be counterfeit, or faked. 

The unique software that runs the Bitcoin network eliminates the possibility of duplicating money for counterfeit purposes.  

New bitcoin can only be issued if there is agreement amongst the participants in the network. People who are voluntarily running bitcoin software on their own computers and smartphones.

This ensures that it is impossible to counterfeit, or create fake bitcoins.
NoCounterfeitMoney.title:
Special Characteristic #3: 
No Counterfeit Money

answers: One whole bitcoin. It is not possible to use anything less.
0.01 BTC
feedback: Yes. You can divide a bitcoin into 100,000,000 pieces. As you already know, the smallest unit of bitcoin — B0.00000001 — is known as a “sat”.
Wrong. Bitcoin is highly divisible. You can easily use a very small fraction of a bitcoin.
Incorrect. Although the smallest unit of US currency is one penny, a bitcoin is divisible by much more than 100x.
HighlyDivisible.question: What is the smallest amount of Bitcoin one can own, or use?
HighlyDivisible.text:
Old-fashioned fiat money can only be spent in amounts as small as one penny — or two decimal places for one US Dollar ($0.01).

On the other hand, Bitcoin can be divided 100,000,000 times over. This means that you could spend as little as ₿0.00000001. You will note the "₿" symbol, which is the Bitcoin equivalent of "$". Sometimes you will also see the use of BTC, instead of ₿.

By way of contrast, Bitcoin can handle very small payments — even those less than one US penny!
HighlyDivisible.title:
Special Characteristic #4: 
Highly Divisible

answers: Evet. Bitcoin ağı çok güvenlidir.
Belki. Haftanın hangi gününde olduğuna göre değişir.
No. It is open source software, and is easily attacked.
feedback: Correct. In fact, the Bitcoin network has never once been hacked. Answer the next question to learn more!
Nice try, but wrong. The bitcoin network is safe and secure — 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.
Icorrect. Although bitcoin is indeed “open source” software — or available to the public for free — is still extremely secure.
securePartOne.question: Bitcoin ağı güvenli midir?
securePartOne.text:
The bitcoin network is worth well over $100 billion today. Accordingly, the network must be very secure — so that money is never stolen. 

Bitcoin is known as the world’s first cryptocurrency. 

The “crypto” part of the name comes from cryptography. Simply put, cryptography protects information through very complex math functions. 

Most people do not realize — but Bitcoin is actually the most secure computer network in the world ! 

(you may have heard about bitcoin “hacks” — which we will debunk in the next quiz)
securePartOne.title:
Special Characteristic #5: 
Secure -- Part I

answers: Bitcoin hiç hacklenmedi.
Yes. Bitcoin gets hacked frequently.
Yes. Bitcoin usually gets hacked on holidays, when traditional banks are closed.
feedback: That is correct. The bitcoin network has never been compromised. However, it is important to use only secure digital wallets to keep your personal bitcoins safe at all times.
Wrong. Please try again.
No silly, you know that is not the correct answer.
securePartTwo.question: Bitcoin hiç hacklendi mi?
securePartTwo.text:
To be direct: the bitcoin network itself has never been hacked. Never once.

Then what exactly has been hacked? 

Certain digital wallets that did not have proper security in place. 

Just like a physical wallet holds fiat currency (in the form of paper bills), digital wallets hold some amount of bitcoin. 

In the physical world, criminals rob banks — and walk away with US Dollars. The fact that someone robbed a bank does not have any relationship as to whether the US Dollar is stable or reliable money. 

Similarly, some computer hackers have stolen bitcoin from insecure digital wallets — the online equivalent of a bank robbery. 

However, it is important to know that the bitcoin network has never been hacked or compromised !
securePartTwo.title:
Special Characteristic #5: 
Secure -- Part II

SendBitcoinConfirmationScreen.stalePrice: Your bitcoin price is old and was last updated {timePeriod} ago. Please restart the app before making a payment.

SendBitcoinConfirmationScreen.totalExceed: Total exceeds your balance of {balance: string}
SendBitcoinConfirmationScreen.maxFeeSelected: This is the maximum fee you will be charged for this transaction.  It may end up being less once the payment has been made.

SendBitcoinDestinationScreen.usernameNowAddress: {bankName: string} usernames are now {bankName: string} addresses.
SendBitcoinDestinationScreen.usernameNowAddressInfo:
When you enter a {bankName: string} username, we will add "@{lnDomain: string}" to it (e.g maria@{lnDomain: string}) to make it an address. Your username is now a {bankName: string} address too.

Go to your {bankName: string} address page from your Settings to learn how to use it or to share it to receive payments.
SendBitcoinDestinationScreen.destinationOptions: You can send to a {bankName: string} address, LN address, LN invoice, or BTC address.
SendBitcoinDestinationScreen.expiredInvoice: This invoice has expired. Please generate a new invoice.
SendBitcoinDestinationScreen.wrongNetwork: This invoice is for a different network. Please generate a new invoice.
SendBitcoinDestinationScreen.invalidAmount: This contains an invalid amount. Please regenerate with a valid amount.
SendBitcoinDestinationScreen.usernameDoesNotExist: {lnAddress: string} doesn't seem to be a {bankName: string} address that exists.
SendBitcoinDestinationScreen.usernameDoesNotExistAdvice: Either make sure the spelling is right or ask the recipient for an LN invoice or BTC address instead.
SendBitcoinDestinationScreen.selfPaymentAdvice: If you want to send money to another account that you own, you can use an invoice, LN or BTC address instead.
SendBitcoinDestinationScreen.lnAddressError: We can't reach this Lightning address. If you are sure it exists, you can try again later.
SendBitcoinDestinationScreen.lnAddressAdvice: Either make sure the spelling is right or ask the recipient for an invoice or BTC address instead.
SendBitcoinDestinationScreen.unknownLightning: We can't parse this Lightning address. Please try again.
SendBitcoinDestinationScreen.unknownOnchain: We can't parse this Bitcoin address. Please try again.
SendBitcoinDestinationScreen.newBankAddressUsername: {lnAddress: string} exists as a {bankName: string} address, but you've never sent money to it.

confirmModal.body:
Please make sure the recipient gave you a {bankName: string} address, **not a username from another wallet**. Otherwise, the money will go to a {bankName: string} Account that has the “{lnAddress: string}” address.

Check the spelling of the first part of the address as well. e.g. jackie and jack1e are 2 different addresses
confirmModal.warning: If the {bankName: string} address is entered incorrectly, {bankName: string} can't undo the transaction.

but is not confirmed yet

You can check the status

StablesatsModal.body: You can use it to send and receive Bitcoin, and instantly transfer value between your BTC and USD account. Value in the USD account will not fluctuate with the price of Bitcoin. This feature is not compatible with the traditional banking system.

SplashScreen.update:
Your app is outdated. An update is needed before the app can be used.

This can be done from the PlayStore for Android and Testflight for iOS

UsernameScreen.confirmSubtext: The username is permanent and can not be changed later
UsernameScreen.forbiddenStart: Cannot start with lnbc1, bc1, 1, or 3 and cannot be a Bitcoin address or Lightning invoice
UsernameScreen.letterAndNumber: Only lowercase letter, number and underscore (_) are accepted
UsernameScreen.emailAddress: Username must not be email address
UsernameScreen.usernameToUse: What username do you want to use?

WelcomeFirstScreen.bank: Bitcoin is designed to let you store, send and receive money, without relying on a bank or credit card.
WelcomeFirstScreen.before: Before Bitcoin, people had to rely on banks or credit card providers, to spend, send and receive money.
WelcomeFirstScreen.learn: I don't mean to badger you, but there's lot more to learn, dig in...

WelcomePhoneInputScreen.header: Telefon numaranızı girdiğinizde sizinle bir giriş kodu paylaşacağız.

WelcomePhoneValidationScreen.errorLoggingIn: Giriş yaparken hata oldu. Doğru kodu kullandığınıza emin misiniz?
WelcomePhoneValidationScreen.header: Telefon numaranızı onaylamamız için {phoneNumber: string} gönderdiğimiz kodu giriniz.

common.reauth: Oturumunuz kapandı. Lütfen tekrar giriş yapın.

errors.generic:
Bir hata oluştu.
Lütfen daha sonra tekrar deneyin.
errors.tooManyRequestsPhoneCode: Too many requests. Please wait before requesting another text message.

network.server: Sunucu hatası. Lütfen sonra tekrar deneyin.
network.request:
Request issue.
Contact support if the problem persists
network.connection:
Bağlantı sorunu
Lütfen internet bağlantınızı kontrol edin.

errors.problemPersists: Problem devam ederse destek birimine ulaşın
errors.fatalError: Sorry we appear to be having issues loading the application data.  If problems persist please contact support.

payment.body: Az önce hesabınıza {value: string} sats geldi
payment.title: Ödeme alındı.

support.defaultSupportMessage: Hey there! I need some help with Bitcoin Beach Wallet
